level.text: The Mayor, pursuant to Chapter 5 of Title 2, shall adopt rules, to establish or revise fees for entity filings authorized to be delivered to the Mayor for filing under this title and for copying and certifying a copy of any entity filing under this title.
There shall be no fee for filing a registered agent's statement of resignation.

The withdrawal under § 29-102.04 of a filed record before it is effective or the correction of a filed record under § 29-102.05 shall not entitle the person on whose behalf the record was filed to a refund of the filing fee.

The rules proposed pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall be submitted to the Council for a 45-day period of review, excluding Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, and days of Council recess. If the Council does not approve the proposed rules, in whole or in part, by resolution within this 45-day review period, the proposed rules shall be deemed approved.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-305 substituted "deemed approved" for "deemed disapproved" in (d).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-305
level.text: Law 19-305, the "Benefit Corporation Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-584. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 2012, and December 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 11, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-672 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-305 became effective on May 1, 2013.
